abstracts.cdata!:
Achievement of the development objective
            was rated satisfactory: the project was successful in
            achieving its objective of providing temporary employment
            for unskilled and semi-skilled laborers. Project
            sustainability is rated as likely. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are rated satisfactory. Lessons
            learned included the following: Using existing and
            well-functioning programs to channel funds for emergency
            operations can be effective. The use of existing mechanisms
            for disbursement and financial control can give a project
            immediate impetus and reduce the time needed for
            preparation. Decentralized assistance to the client by the
            Bank can be a determining factor in project success. It is
            especially useful for task teams to be close to the client
            in emergency projects with short implementation periods.
            Statistics on employment generation can be misleading and
            need to be carefully interpreted. Quick implementation of
            emergency community projects requires decentralized,
            streamlined implementation procedures. Simplified
            procurement methods and disbursement procedures can be a
            major factor in speeding up project implementation. Strong
            project ownership is a determining factor for success. In
            emergency operations, detailed analysis of the longer terms
            issues related to sustainability and risk should be done at
            project preparation. A review should be taken with other
            donors to assess how these types of projects can be scaled
            up and how they can have a greater impact.
